manifold_alternatives.description: Our best replacement manifold of carbon steel

data.key_notes: DOHC evolution of the Modular architecture (introduced 2011); high-revving design for Mustangs/F-150s; variants include Gen 1–4 with direct injection.
SOHC V8 from the Modular family; truck-oriented with 3-valve heads and variable cam timing; used in F-Series and Expedition.
Standalone pushrod (cam-in-block) family (introduced 2020) for heavy-duty trucks like Super Duty; replaces older V10s; iron block, 430–450 hp stock.
Marinized version of GM's LS-series V8; purpose-modified for sterndrive and inboard boats; introduced around 2014; 300–430 hp.
Two-stroke diesel engine adapted for marine use; widely used in commercial vessels since the 1940s; 165–230 hp in marine configs.
Licensed Rolls-Royce Eagle derivative; water-cooled SOHC V12; primary U.S. producer (~13,000 built); used in WWI aircraft.
Early 20th-century water-cooled SOHC V8 aircraft engine (introduced 1914); ~150 hp; widely used in WWI fighters like the SPAD S.VII.
WWII-era liquid-cooled V12 (introduced 1937); up to 1,475 hp in turbocharged variants; powered U.S. fighters like the P-38 Lightning.
Purpose-built V12 gasoline engine (circa 1930s–1940s) for marine use; used in WWII rescue boats and patrol craft; up to 650 hp in supercharged variants.
